description: From Middle English duchesse, from Old French duchesse.

entries.meaning: The wife or widow of a duke.
examples: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have ended months of intense speculation by announcing they are expecting their first child, but were forced to share their news earlier than hoped because of the Duchess's admission to hospital on Monday.

entries.meaning: The female ruler of a duchy.

verbs.description: duchess (third-person singular simple present duchesses, present participle duchessing, simple past and past participle duchessed)

entries.meaning: (Australia, informal) to court or curry favour for political or business advantage; to flatter obsequiously.
examples: ‘A word to the wise, Murray. Those wogs you′ve been duchessing at Ethnic Affairs have got nothing on the culture vultures. Tear the flesh right off your bones, they will.’
